newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Angola aims to revive once-great coffee industry.
newsitem.headline: Angola aims to revive once-great coffee industry.

text.p: Angola, once one of the world's most important coffee producers, is determined to revive the war-ravaged industry and hopes to lift output back to colonial levels, Planning Minister Emanuel Carneiro said.

"The coffee sector has been seriously affected by the war and the government considers it one of its priorities to reactivate coffee production," he said in an interview at an investment conference in Harare on Thursday.
"In a few years we believe we can again achieve production levels of the colonial days."
Before Angola gained indepedence from Portugal in 1975 it was Africa's second largest producer of coffee, harvesting around 230,000 tonnes.

But civil war has seen output plunge to a meagre 5,000 tonnes in 1996. This year's harvest is expected to increase to 8,000 tonnes and industry officials have suggested 60,000 tonnes as a feasible target within five years.
